questions.question: 彼は約束を（　　　）しまいました。
questions.hint:
約束やくそく (yakusoku) - promise
やぶって (破って, yabutte) - to break

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉
『やぶって』 (yabutte) means 'to break (a promise).' It matches the context where someone failed to keep their word.

  • やぶって – to break (破って, yabutte)
  • つかって – to use (使って, tsukatte)
  • のこして – to leave behind (残して, nokoshite)
  • まもって – to keep/protect (守って, mamotte)

Sentence meaning: He broke his promise.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: やぶって (破って, yabutte) - to break

  • やぶって – broke the promise
  • つかって – used something, unrelated
  • のこして – left something behind, illogical
  • まもって – kept the promise (opposite meaning)

Sentence meaning: He broke his promise.

questions.question: 最近、運動する（　　　）がない。
questions.hint:
機会きかい (kikai) - opportunity
運動うんどう (undou) - exercise

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉
『きかい』 (kikai) means 'opportunity,' which fits with the verb 'to do exercise.'

  • きかい – opportunity (機会, kikai)
  • じしん – confidence (自信, jishin)
  • けっか – result (結果, kekka)
  • ばしょ – place (場所, basho)

Sentence meaning: Recently, I haven't had the opportunity to exercise.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: きかい (機会, kikai) - opportunity

  • きかい – appropriate word to describe 'not having a chance'
  • じしん – confidence, not related
  • けっか – result, doesn’t match the sentence
  • ばしょ – place, grammatically unnatural here

Sentence meaning: Recently, I haven't had the opportunity to exercise.

questions.question: この部屋はいつも（　　　）です。
questions.hint:
清潔せいけつ (seiketsu) - clean/neat
部屋へや (heya) - room

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉
『せいけつ』 (seiketsu) means 'clean' or 'neat,' suitable for describing a room.

  • せいけつ – clean (清潔, seiketsu)
  • ふべん – inconvenient (不便, fuben)
  • ふくざつ – complicated (複雑, fukuzatsu)
  • へんぴ – remote (辺鄙, henpi)

Sentence meaning: This room is always clean.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: せいけつ (清潔, seiketsu) - clean

  • せいけつ – matches the context
  • ふべん – means inconvenient, unrelated
  • ふくざつ – complicated, not used for rooms
  • へんぴ – remote, more about location

Sentence meaning: This room is always clean.

questions.question: 彼の説明はとても（　　　）でわかりやすい。
questions.hint:
丁寧ていねい (teinei) - polite/detailed
説明せつめい (setsumei) - explanation

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉
『ていねい』 (teinei) means 'polite' or 'careful,' making the explanation easy to understand.

  • ていねい – polite/detailed (丁寧, teinei)
  • あいまい – vague (曖昧, aimai)
  • きゅう – sudden (急, kyuu)
  • ざつ – rough/careless (雑, zatsu)

Sentence meaning: His explanation is very polite and easy to understand.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: ていねい (丁寧, teinei) - polite

  • ていねい – means polite/detailed
  • あいまい – vague, opposite meaning
  • きゅう – sudden, not fitting
  • ざつ – rough, unclear explanation

Sentence meaning: His explanation is very polite and easy to understand.

questions.question: 電車の中では携帯電話を（　　　）ください。
questions.hint:
消けす (kesu) - to turn off
携帯電話けいたいでんわ (keitai denwa) - cell phone

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉
『けして』 (keshite) means 'turn off.' It's polite to turn off your phone on the train.

  • しずかにして – be quiet (静かにして, shizuka ni shite)
  • けして – turn off (消して, keshite)
  • つかって – use (使って, tsukatte)
  • はなして – talk (話して, hanashite)

Sentence meaning: Please turn off your mobile phone on the train.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: けして (消して, keshite) - turn off

  • けして – correct form to request turning off a phone
  • しずかにして – be quiet, not specific to phones
  • つかって – use, not appropriate here
  • はなして – talk, not about power usage

Sentence meaning: Please turn off your mobile phone on the train.
